intro: Tephrocactus chichensis, commonly known as the Chichén Cactus, is a species native to southern Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a ribbed stem that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant features spines that vary in color from white to yellow, and it produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in the arid landscapes of its native habitat.
